In appearance she is Vulcan with pointed ears, but her skin is fair and she has none of the expressionless facial immobility of a Vulcan.

direction.raw_text: Another hit: reverberating flashes of spark and flame on the bridge. Spock dies. Bones comes to him, but even as he coughs his way through the smoke, a final hit and Bones falls. The room is smoke filled and a shambles. Saavik looks about in shock.

Out of the airlock steps a tall masked figure. A moment of suspense as Terrell and Chekov watch, terri- fied. The mask is peeled back.

direction.raw_text: The wind howls in the silence. When Khan turns, his eyes are filled with tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He recovers his poise and returns to them -- KHAN (continuing) You didn't expect to find me. You thought this was Ceti Alpha VI. Why are you here? They don't answer. Khan goes over to Terrell and, WITH ONE HAND, LIFTS HIM INTO THE AIR -- KHAN (continuing) Why? Terrell gasps, stays silent -- KHAN (continuing) No matter. He lets go; Terrell falls with a thud -- KHAN (continuing) You will soon tell me willingly enough. He goes over to the tank and dips a kind of strainer in, pulling out TWO CETI EELS -- wriggling items -- KHAN (continuing) Let me introduce you to Ceti Alpha V's only remaining indigenous life form; what do you think? They've killed twenty of my people, including my beloved wife. Oh, not all at once and not instantly, to be sure. Their young enter through the ears and wrap themselves around the cerebral cortex. This has the effect of rendering the victim extremely susceptible to suggestion. Later, as they grow, follows madness, paralysis -- and death. These are pets, of course -- not quite domesticated. As he speaks, Khan dumps an eel in each of their helmets; he swirls the helmets around as though he were mixing martinis -- CHEKOV Khan, listen to me! Captain Kirk was only doing his duty! You -- 26   CLOSE UP - KHAN - CAMERA IN                                 26 KHAN There is some pain at first, I am told, and then the effects are quite benign -- until the end. That was what I learned from watching my wife. At a sign, the helmets are slammed down. As the muffled shrieks are heard from within, the eels crawl across the faces of Chekov and Terrell; with unerring in- stincts they head for the ears of the two hapless men. There is some atrocious pain as they enter -- then dazed calm.

dialogue.raw_text: (aloud despite himself) Khan!

dialogue.raw_text: (finally) I don't know you. But you. I never forget a face. Mister Chekov, isn't it? (wonderingly) I never thought to see your face again.

dialogue.raw_text: Chekov, who is this man?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A criminal, Captain -- a product of the late 20th Century genetic engineering -- TERRELL What do you want with us? I demand -- KHAN (mild) You are in a position to demand nothing, sir. I, on the other hand, am in a position to grant nothing. What you see is all that remains of the ship's company and the crew of the Botany Bay , marooned here fifteen years ago by Captain James T. Kirk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Listen to me -- you men and women -- KHAN Save your strength, Captain, these people have sworn to live and die at my command two hundred years before you were born. Do you mean he... (i.e. Chekov) ... never told you the tale? To amuse you, Captain? Never told you how the Enterprise picked up the Botany Bay , lost in space from the year 1996, myself and the ship's company in cryogenic freeze?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've never even met Admiral Kirk -- KHAN Admiral? He didn't tell you how Admiral Kirk sent seventy of us into exile on this barren sand heap with only the contents of these cargo bays to sustain us?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You lie! On Ceti Alpha V there was life, a fair chance to -- KHAN This is Ceti Alpha V ! Ceti Alpha VI exploded six months after we were left here. The shock shifted the orbit of this planet and everything was laid waste. Admiral Kirk never bothered to check on our progress. It was only the fact of my genetically engineered intellect that enabled us to survive! On earth, two hundred years ago, I was a prince, with power over millions -- now, like Prometheus I have been left by Admiral Kirk to digest my own entrails.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Captain Kirk was your host! You repaid his hospitality by trying to steal his ship and murder him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (moves closer) And I'll wager he never told you about his shipmate, the beautiful and courageous Lieutenant McGiver, who gave up everything to join me in exile. OUT OF LOVE. And see how Admiral Kirk requited her devotion -- She's dead as earth!

The reformed object you see represents the merest fraction of the Genesis potential, should the Federation wish to pursue these experiments to their logical conclusion.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've done far worse than kill you, Admiral. I've hurt you. And I wish to go on hurting you. I shall leave you, as you left me -- where no one will ever find you: poetic justice; marooned for eternity in the center of a dead planet -- buried alive.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Khan -- !
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Goodbye, Admiral. Oh, and don't count on Enterprise. She can't move. My next act will be to blow her out of the heavens.

dialogue.raw_text: Because of you, son. You shouldn't have tried to rush someone holding a primed phaser. Anyway it isn't one man dead, it's two, in case you've lost count.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How can you think of food at a time like this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Our first order of business is survival.

dialogue.raw_text: There's food in the Genesis cave, enough to last a lifetime -- should that be necessary.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We thought this was Genesis.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This? It took the Starfleet corps of engineers ten months in space suits to tunnel out all this. What we did in there -- we did in a day. David, why don't you show Dr. McCoy and the Lieutenant our idea of food.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: David. Please.

dialogue.raw_text: As your teacher Mr. Spock is fond of saying: I like to think there always are possibilities.

dialogue.raw_text: There's a man I haven't seen in fifteen years who thinks he's killed me. You show me a son who'd almost be happy to help him. My son. My life that could have been and wasn't. What am I feeling? I'm feeling old -- worn out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let me show you something that will make you feel young -- young as when the world was new.

dialogue.raw_text: He's intelligent, but not experienced. His pattern indicates two dimensional thinking...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. Saavik, all stop.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All stop, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Descend ten thousand meters. Stand by photon torpedoes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where is he? Where in God's name is he?

Now, behind Reliant and from below, like a great whale rising from the depths, Enterprise rises vertically, slowly passing the unsuspecting enemy. When Enterprise is above, behind and quite close:
direction.name: direction

Khan is blown from his chair and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of his fate.

direction.raw_text: . SPACE NEBULA            211 Reliant, now a scarred, battered hulk, her main hull still intact, but dead in space.

direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Cease fire. Look sharp.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Power levels quite low, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to intercom) Mr. Scott, can you get the mains back on line?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (breaking up slightly) I'll need ten minutes, sir, 'til the radiation dissipates.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uhura, send to Commander, Reliant: prepare to be boarded.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aye, sir.

direction.raw_text: . RELIANT BRIDGE                                        213 Amid the smoke and ruins, WE SEE no signs of life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In f.g., chillingly, Khan rises INTO SHOT by the main console. He is horribly burned, and it is clear that he is clinging to life by his will.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Uhura's voice continues O.S., Khan pulls himself into a chair at the console, one of his hands useless at his side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Painfully, with one good arm, he starts arming the Genesis console.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Commander, Reliant, this is Enterprise. Surrender and prepare to be boarded. Repeat...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No... Kirk. The game's not over.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) To the last I will grapple with thee!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . RELIANT TRANSPORTER ROOM                             213A There sits the Genesis torpedo: lights start blinking in response. As we watch, the CHILD we met on Ceti Alpha walks to the torpedo and smiles at the lights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ENTERPRISE BRIDGE                                     214 UHURA Enterprise to Reliant: you are ordered to surrender your vessel. Respond! (to Kirk) Nothing, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: David peers closer over Spock's shoulder, reacts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The briefest stunned moment. Kirk hits intercom:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spock leaps from his place and disappears through the bridge doors.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We'll beam aboard. Alert transporter room -- SPOCK Admiral. Scanning an energy source on Reliant. A pattern I've never seen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's the Genesis Wave!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's on a build up to detonation!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How soon -- DAVID We encoded four minutes -- KIRK We'll beam aboard and stop it -- DAVID You can't!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Scotty, I need warp speed in three minutes or we're all dead!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Scotty!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Saavik, get us out, best speed!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aye, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE NEBULA                                          215 Enterprise backs away from Reliant. Her speed is pain- fully slow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RELIANT BRIDGE                                        216 ON SCREEN, Enterprise, intermittent image, backs away. Khan smiles triumphantly through his pain. An elec- tronic power SOUND has been building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Khan topples forward, dead. The WHINE continues to build chillingly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No... You can't get away... From hell's heart I stab at thee... (amid the pain) For hate's sake... I spit my last breath at thee!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ENTERPRISE ENGINE ROOM                                217 Spock rushes in. Bones ministers to Scotty, b.g. Spock sizes up the situation, starts for the radiation room, Bones intercepts him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gives Bones the Vulcan nerve pinch. Bones goes down. Spock presses the access button and enters the Reactor Room, a separated area behind radiation-proof glass and metal, RED FLASHING LIGHTS and an iridescent blue glow within.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Are you out of your Vulcan mind? No human can tolerate the radiation loose in there!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But, as you are so fond of observing, Doctor, I'm not human.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're not going in there -- !
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm afraid I can't stop to discuss this logically --
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (in horror) Spock -- get out of there!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ENTERPRISE REACTOR ROOM                               219 Bathed in blue light, arcing energy around him, Spock is a silhouetted figure as he goes to work, door clos- ing behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SPACE - RELIANT                                       220 The WHINE increasing, the dead ship Reliant alive with danger...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SPACE NEBULA - ENTERPRISE                             221 A snail's pace compared to the escape speed needed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ENTERPRISE BRIDGE                                     222 KIRK Time from my mark...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Two minutes, ten seconds.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (intercom) Engine room! What's happening?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ENTERPRISE REACTOR ROOM (INTERCUT AS                  223 REQUIRED) Outside the glass, Scotty and Bones screaming:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Captain, please!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get out! Get out, man! Oh, dear God...!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: the silent urging of Bones and Scotty. Spock is oblivious. Amid the fire-blue arcs, he moves to the control panel. Between his hands and the con- trols, power arcs insanely. Spock is in an inferno, a radiation hell, fighting now with all his strength to control it. Slowly, the damping rods move out. Spock moves to a manual control, begins to turn it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on the manual control, slowly turning black.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His face, using all the self discipline he is capable of to control the pain, continuing to work -- 227   WITHOUT                                                    227 Bones and Scotty react in helpless horror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SPACE NEBULA                                          228 Enterprise still well within the nebula, Reliant a figure still visible in b.g. She's crawling still.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ENTERPRISE BRIDGE                                     229 Reliant, now symbol of death, ON SCREEN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk looks at David, but David shakes his head: No way. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She increases power and -- 230   EXT. SPACE NEBULA - SERIES OF SHOTS                        230 A)   With a burst of warp speed, Enterprise accelerates out of the lazy pace and whooshes PUT OF SCENE, leaving Reliant behind. B)   POV RELIANT disappearing in the swirls of: C)   POV MUTARA NEBULA which clears the flame and -- D)   ENTERPRISE roaring through space -- and: E)   RELIANT The WHINE increases to fever pitch, then: she goes! F)   EXT. MUTARA NEBULA - MASTER EFFECT As Reliant goes, so goes the nebula. The "Genesis Effect" WE SAW in its earliest experiments, now seems familiar on a gigantic, cosmic scale. The blinding flash at first, followed by the same tumbling turbulence of the miniature test. It is awesome.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Time!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Three minutes, thirty seconds.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ENTERPRISE BRIDGE                                     231 The bridge doors open and Carol appears. Instinctively she draws near her son. Finally, Kirk turns, sees Carol -- KIRK Reduce speed. My God, Carl. Look at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and INTERCUT -- GENESIS TUMBLES and starts evolving. A moment in history.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The tone frightens Kirk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He moves through the doors quickly, leaving the rest staring at the new world evolving.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing, on intercom) Engine Room. Well done. Scotty?

dialogue.raw_text: (after a beat) Jim, you'd better get down here. Hurry.

dialogue.raw_text: Saavik, take the con.

SPACE AND ON SCREEN                                   233 The clouds tumble and move, new things lie beyond -- 234   INT. STAIRS                                                234 Kirk races -- 235   INT. ENTERPRISE ENGINE ROOM                                235 Kirk emerges to encounter Scotty and Bones. Their looks tell him. He sees the flashing light over the Reactor Room. He dashes for the control panel. Bones grabs him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk's eyes bulge.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No, sir! You'll flood the whole compartment...!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He'll die -- !
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (also holds him) He's dead already, Jim.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, God.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: AT REACTOR ROOM GLASS DOOR                           236 With stunned understanding, Kirk stumbles to the door, sees Spock on his knees, hands blackened, face cracked with radiation lines and scars. Spock shakes his head. With a feeble hand he reaches the intercom button: filtered communication.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spock is satisfied; he fights for breath -- SPOCK Don't grieve, Admiral -- it's logical: the good of the many outweighs -- He almost keels over. Kirk has tears streaming down his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He props a hand on the glass to support himself. Kirk's hand reflexively goes to match Spock's on the other side of the glass -- SPOCK (continuing) I never took the Kobayashi Maru test -- until now. What do you think of my solution?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spock falls. Bones and Scotty react.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Kirk is past hearing or caring. He is huddled up against the glass, destroyed. Bones looks on, helpless.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Spock!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The ship -- out of danger?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... the good of the few...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Or the one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Spock...!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have been -- and always will be
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: your friend... Live. Long. And. Prosper.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (intercom) Admiral, you've got to see this! There's new life -- a whole new world, a Genesis world -- !
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE                                                 237 A spectacular look at Carol's planet being born!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the Ship's Company in full dress uniforms assembled for ship's burial service. Over the PULLBACK, we HEAR:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carol and David are PROMINENTLY FEATURED. David watching Kirk attentively. So are Sulu, Uhura, Chekov, and Saavik. Bones stands next to Kirk. Scotty carries his bagpipes. Saavik wears her hair down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He tries to go on, but catches Bones' face: Bones is streaming tears. Kirk can't go on.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: 238 OMITTED 238 239 CAMERA PULLS BACK TO REVEAL 239

dialogue.raw_text: In accordance with the traditions of Starfleet and of Article 184 Starfleet Regulations, we are assembled here today to pay final respects to our honored dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) And yet, in the midst of our sorrow it should be noted that this death takes place in the shadow of new life, the sunrise of a new world, a world that our beloved comrade gave his own life to protect and nourish. He did not feel that sacrifice a vain or empty one -- and we will not debate his profound wisdom, in these proceedings. Of my friend, I can only say this, that of all the souls I have encountered in my travels, his was the most -- (he falters)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: human.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Lieutenant Saavik.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Saavik steps forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All Starfleet personnel salute. Scotty begins to PIPE, an odd blare which mellows into Amazing Grace . Kirk nods a signal.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We commend the soul of our brother departed. We love we commit his body to the depths of space.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Honors -- hup!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A gleaming black projectile is carried by pallbearers into the launching chamber, which locks behind it. At a hand signal from a TORPEDOMAN, the projectile is fired.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SPACE                                                 243 Spock's remains seen on their way to the new world. The capsule grows too small to SEE. The bagpipes STOP.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TORPEDO ROOM                                          244 SULU Return -- hup! The salute drop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She steps to him and they exchange salutes -- KIRK (continuing; very quietly) After you dismiss the company, you will take the watch. Set course for Ceti Alpha V and we'll pick up survivors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They salute. She about-faces as Kirk walks towards the  Turbo Lift. Saavik issues dismissal and posting orders, but WE TRUCK with Kirk until CAMERA STOPS and he leaves FRAME and WE HOLD on David. He finally understands.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Lieutenant.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aye, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll be in my quarters if needed, but I would prefer...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Understood, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (aloud) Dismiss the company.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . KIRK'S QUARTERS                                       245 After a long moment, the CAMERA DISCOVERS Kirk. He pours a drink, then decides not to have it. He sits wearily, not knowing how to shake the ghosts. Then he sees the book. Kirk picks up the battered volume, the gift from his friend, and closes his eyes a moment. Almost idly he starts turning pages, looking for a clue. But he can't see the writing -- he rummages through his pockets and pulls out the half-glasses -- One of the lenses is broken. It has a deep impact on Kirk. He puts down the book and glasses and covers his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Kirk clears his throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door whooshes open and closes to admit David. The last person Kirk expected to see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: David's strength is turning a corner with Kirk -- KIRK I suppose I was. (pause) I poured a drink. Would you like it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pause. They study each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A stunned moment, then Kirk lets it all hang out: for David, for Carol and for Spock. He hugs his son, hold- ing onto him as if to life itself.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Yes... come.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't mean to intrude.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh, no... (rises) I should be on the bridge.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you running away from me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. I -- I guess I'm not what you expected.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (rueful) I didn't expect anything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That makes two of us. (he studies his father) Lieutenant Saavik was right: you never have faced death -- KIRK (hoarse) Not like this -- no. I haven't faced death, I cheated death. I tricked my way out of death and patted myself on the back for my ingenuity. I know nothing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You knew enough to tell Saavik that how we face death is at least as important as how we face life -- KIRK It was just words.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But good words. That's where ideas begin. Maybe you should listen to them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm trying, David.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So am I. My friends were killed, too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am truly sorry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was wrong about you. And I'm sorry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is that what you came here to say?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mainly. (he starts out, then turns -- ) And also that I'm proud -- very proud -- to be your son.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SPACE                                                 246 The Enterprise passes the new planet in all its beauty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ENTERPRISE BRIDGE                                     247 The door whooshes. Kirk strides on the bridge, David with him. Carol is there with Bones; they are glad at what they see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Saavik comes close to blushing -- KIRK (continuing) Yes, well, why don't you show him around and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She takes him off, deadpan amusement -- SAAVIK (continuing) So you turn out to be the dumb bastard. They stare at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kirk has a smile. He joins Bones and Carol facing the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He shakes his head, remembering -- BONES You okay, Jim? How do you feel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns to Saavik and David -- KIRK (continuing) Lieutenant, new course: 'Second star to the right and straight on till morning.' The bridge crackles with lights and CHATTER as we...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Admiral on the bridge!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As you were, Mr. Saavik.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aye, sir. On course to Ceti Alpha. All is well.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good, I believe you already know my, uh, son --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aye, sir --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) That is a little joke.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's changed her hair again. (pause) Will you look at that? Think they'll name it for you, Doctor?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not if I can help it. We'll name it for our friend.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) It is a far far better thing I do than I have ever done before... a far better resting place I go to than I have ever known...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (soft) Is that a poem?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Something Spock was trying to tell me. On my birthday.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (considers; smiles) Young. I feel young, Doctor.
dialogue.name: dialogue
